trial_identification.studytitle: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Etelcalcetide in Healthy Male Volunteers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Rising Single Intravenous Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of KAI-4169 in Healthy Male Volunteers

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Etelcalcetide Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Placebo Comparator: Placebo - Participants received a single dose of placebo intravenous injection.
Experimental: Etelcalcetide - Participants received a single dose of etelcalcetide intravenous injection; the starting dose was 0.5 mg.
Treatment: drugs: Etelcalcetide Administered as a single intravenous (IV) injection
Treatment: drugs: Placebo Administered as a single intravenous (IV) injection

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
primaryOutcome.timepoint: From the first dose of study drug through 7 days.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percent Change From Baseline in Serum Parathyroid Hormone
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 36, 42 and 48 hours post-dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percent Change From Baseline in Plasma Ionized Calcium
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 36, 42 and 48 hours post-dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change From Baseline in Serum Total Calcium
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 36, 42 and 48 hours post-dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change From Baseline in Serum Corrected Calcium
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 36, 42 and 48 hours post-dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change From Baseline in Serum Phosphate
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 36, 42 and 48 hours post-dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percent Change From Baseline in Serum Calcitonin
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 3, 12, 24, and 48 hours post-dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percent Change From Baseline in Serum 1,25 (OH)2 Vitamin D

Maximum Observed Concentration (Cmax) for Etelcalcetide - Plasma samples were analyzed for levels of etelcalcetide for pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis using a validated liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC/MS) method.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve Between the Time of Dose and the Last Time Point (AUCall) for Etelcalcetide
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Observed Area Under the Concentration-time Curve Extrapolated to Infinity (AUCINFobs) for Etelcalcetide
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percent Observed Area Under the Concentration-time Curve Extrapolated to Infinity Resulting From Extrapolation to Concentration of 0 ng/mL (AUC%Extrapobs)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Terminal Elimination Rate Constant (?z) for Etelcalcetide
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Half-life Associated With the Terminal (Log-linear) Elimination Phase (HL?z) for Etelcalcetide
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.
Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Volume of Distribution at Steady State for Etelcalcetide
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood samples for PK assessment were drawn pre-dose, at 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 minutes, post-dose, and at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 hours after drug administration.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of Participants With Antibodies to Etelcalcetide - Serum samples were analyzed for antibodies against etelcalcetide using a validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Samples for antibody analysis were collected pre-dose and between days 7-12 and days 21-28.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Male between 18 and 45 years of age who have provided written informed consent
- Subject is judged to be in good health based on medical history, physical examination, and routine laboratory tests
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- History or presence of any significant acute or chronic illness (e.g., cardiovascular, pulmonary, hepatic, renal, hematologic, gastrointestinal, endocrine, immunologic, dermatologic, or neurologic disease) according to the investigator
- History of any ongoing medical condition requiring treatment with prescription medication
- History of asthma, severe allergies including skin reactions or prior anaphylactic type reactions
- Clinically significant abnormalities on screening clinical examination or laboratory safety tests
- History of drug or alcohol abuse

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to characterize the safety and tolerability of etelcalcetide in healthy young males.
